quote: Asking questions, having help curating ideas, double-checking my work, reviewing PowerPoint designs, creating designs, and copywriting or editing text.
In my personal life, this would be more logo or tattoo ideas that I have, or just different graphics and work. It could be related to PowerPoint or creating slideshows and decks.
This would be anything that I would typically Google. I probably go to AI now.
I think, especially when using the free version, the image and graphics creation can be quite limited. When you ask it to change things about the image, it can also be a bit restricted.

I was trying to create an idea for a tattoo that I wanted to get, and I kept asking it to change the style of the image to replicate another style more. I even included reference images, but it just wasn't able to recreate it in the way I was hoping.

I think it would be great to combine an AI assistant with my calendar and my lists, similar to Siri. It would be helpful to say, "Oh, create this list and remind me on this day," and maybe even be able to talk aloud to it, really utilizing it.

I use it a lot for brainstorming, so having that back-and-forth interaction would be beneficial. Additionally, if we are having a brainstorming session, it would be nice to have a summary of notes at the end.
I also wish it was a bit more opinionated at times, as it can be somewhat wishy-washy when you ask for its opinion on something.

I think sometimes I'm looking for it to look at the facts and draw an opinion based on those facts. I'm not saying it's 100% what I would believe, but if you're trying to decide on something, I'm looking for something that is unbiased and without personal impact to create and form an opinion that I can then use as I develop my own opinion.

This could be really anything, like, "Oh, I'm having this issue with a friend. What do you think of the situation?" Or sometimes it can be about emotional things, like, "I'm feeling this way and I want an objective opinion on whether this is irrational or if this is something that is real," that kind of stuff.

I'm looking for a hands-off dictation type situation where I can think aloud. I want to be able to say, "Oh, create this list," and then I can tell everything I want on the list, and it can formulate it itself. Or, "I want to make this grocery list. Can you organize it by category?" or "Add this to my calendar. Remind me of this thing that's coming up," that kind of stuff.
I don't think the experience is much different than a survey necessarily. I personally prefer not to do video or oral interviews. A written survey would be more preferable to me, I think.
I think for most people, it feels more comfortable to write things down and answer multiple choice questions rather than having to say it out loud and find the space where they can speak candidly.
I don't think most people are comfortable having their videos recorded and talking to the camera for something like this.
